Reviews.Title: “Thought of everything”
Reviews.Author: SpaGuyJim
Reviews.Content: Several years ago, a friend of mine who reviews hotels for a living, suggested that I try this place next time I visited Montreal. At the time, I checked it out, but thought that it was a little out of my price range as there are often great deals for hotel rooms in Montreal. This time, I was travelling with my senior managers and I really wanted to treat them to something special. We booked 5 rooms and a meeting room for half a day, and the bill was just over $1,700, which I thought was reasonable. This hotel is close to both old Montreal and the downtown area. It is beautifully decorated, the staff are very friendly and professional. My room was upgraded (maybe because I was picking up the tab?), and it was lovely. Large bathroom with a soaking tub and shower. All up to date and modern amenities, HD TV, free WI-FI, fancy phones, you name it. My only complaint; I didn't like the pillows - too soft for my taste, but I didn't ask for an alternative, so ended up not having the best sleep, but that was my fault. I didn't use the spa, but I did take a tour. While it is very smalll and in the basement it is in a very cool space. Two people in my group had treatments and loved it. Certainly worth the money to experience total luxury in the heart of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Special place in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: lingjet
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited the Hotel Le St-James in Montreal. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. Our trip was to purely enjoy the city. The hotel embraced our quest and helped us in any way they could to enjoy Montreal. In the heart of the Old Town, this hotel is a perfect fit. The restaurant XO staff and food were great as well. Rumor has it on the street that the top Celebrities stay here as well, even though we could not coax any information from the staff (very discreet). Bottom line, great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.... Loved it....”
Reviews.Author: PassportAlwaysOnHand
Reviews.Content: As I was driving across the boarder, the customs agent says "So what do you do for a living?". I said "I am in the banking industry". He says "Sorry to hear that... Where are you staying?". I said "Hotel Le St. James in Montreal". He says "Wow... I guess the banking industry can't be THAT bad". I had to laugh.... Then I understood his comment. Impeccable experience. Montreal is one of my favorite places, and I have family from there. This was clearly a place to stay with your significant other, and I probably wouldn't stay here unless that were the situation. However, rooms? Beautiful. Bed? Unbelievably comfortable. Location? Great. Furnishing? Impeccable. Staff? Fantastic. Spa? Same. Can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Donald L
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed at Hotel Le St-James, definitly the place to sleep in old Montreal, great location, The room was unique, sophisticated..... The bed was fantastic! Whithout hesitation willing to come back and enjoyed it again!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe boutique hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: orleyfarm
Reviews.Content: Historic bank bldg. with enormous ceilings, gorgeous furnishings, immaculately maintained, high tech, competent caring staff, spa with exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Pinnacle Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyVisitors_11
Reviews.Content: Let there be no doubt Hotel St-James in Montreal QC is as good an experience of service and customer care as you can find anywhere in the world. Rooms are beautifully appointed although not ridiculously large. The staff is incredibly well trained and selected to support an optimal customer experience. Super location toward both the business and the restaurant district of Old Montreal, this hotel is a must when visiting the this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Accomodations and Location”
Reviews.Author: CosmoWose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved our entire experience in Montreal, which really started with the great folks running this beautiful hotel. Very friendly staff and service. In fact, it was seamless service from the smart/quick & silent maneuvering Doormen upon our arrival, great food at XO Restaurant (dinner at bar, breakfat main room), highly knowledgable Concierge, and great Front Desk -- each deserves a special shout out because each made the entire wknd that much more enjoyable. Our ability to speak French was basic/filled-with-effort/amusing and the staff was gracious to let us practice (but we sucked and they still were very friendly. Not sure why that was so surprising to us, but it was). Room was well appointed and warm. Location in Old Montreal is excellent; a very pleasant stroll down to Rue St-Paul which offers a wide range of great restaurants. We explored a majority of the city to see if we "missed out" on staying somewhere else, and while Montreal offers plenty of great places, we plan to stay at Hotel Le St-James when we visit in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old world building, quite modernly appointed”
Reviews.Author: NashR
Reviews.Content: Flawless service, beautiful building, junior suites are well sized, technology wise in the 21st century, clean and beautiful. The only downside was the view (or lack thereof) as some rooms face inwards (inner courtyard, buildings fairly close by - I guess it's inevitable for some rooms), but we didn't mind. Had a snack at the restaurant and all food was delicious, even olives were prime quality. Breakfast was ordinary (and included if you book via Amex PTS). If you drive, do not plan on parking "nearby", as this is Old Montreal and it's unlikely that you'll find the parking spot, hence hand the keys over and let the hotel valet park it - not the cheapest parking, but then again, if you're looking at the price alone, you should not be staying at this hotel. As per breakfast note above, I recommend booking via Amex PTS as you also get late checkout (4PM) and USD100 credit, which covers drinks and snacks for a couple easily...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: multilingual
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two(2) nights with my wife and found the experience enjoyable except for some funky plumbing issues(old building, old plumbing). The hotel was gracious enough to move us to another room. Otherwise all the rooms were clean, the staff helpful. The decor is cozy with a mix of modern and more traditional elements. It has a luxury feel which is nice. The location is very good as you are a short walk uphill to the business district and never more than a short cab/subway ride from any shopping or sites. You could also stroll through Old Montreal and take in some of the old city which is recommended. It's not my favorite choice in the city but I would still recommend

Reviews.Title: “After the hiccups- good in the end”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterplus
Reviews.Content: First night was disappointing as I did not get the room I booked. They moved me by night two. Private dining room was a disaster as it was not private at all, so we could not hear ourselves over the dinner discussion. Disco music at breakfast and terrible disco lighting in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Nolaoriginal
Reviews.Content: The staff are great, the rooms are so unique and lovely. The bathrooms are also wonderful and I found our room (not sure which 'level' of suite we signed on for) was posh, luxurious and worth the cabbage. I dinged them because the lights in the could-be gorgeous dining room are obnoxious, eat there in the daytime and even then, the place is just...odd. They also double charged us on a room when we had payed for it in advance for the in-laws visit. It was a shame to send them there for their anniversary and have their card charged for the room at check out. They argued at the desk and the staff never found evidence of our having paid for it. The in-laws left upset and we called the hotel and sorted it out the following week. Since that wasn't MY experience, I'll just say make sure you check and double-check if you gift a room to someone that they have their paperwork finalized.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent from the moment we arrived in Montreal. Accomodations were excellent and we were upgraded to an executive suite. Don't now how they did it but the staff always knew our names. The hotel is located between the city's business center and Old Montreal which has numerous galleries and restaurants. Hotel was quiet on the weekend. The restaurant and bar were excellent but quiet. Fitness center was small and we did not use the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Missing on the expected small luxuries”
Reviews.Author: NonTantoFreddo
Reviews.Content: The first time we went to Le St-James, we were pampered, so we decided that it would be our hotel of choice in Montreal for our annual weekend of luxury. The 4th time, we experienced a smiling but neutral response to our problem; most of all: not a word of apology. They read our complaint, though, and offered a free night and breakfast package in compensation. We thought they deserved another try. So we went, this past weekend. As usual, we were asked which newspaper we wanted in the morning. The girl at the desk noted our answer but there was no newspaper at the door the following morning. Plus, the room had been prepared (small bottle of water, robe, slippers, etc.) for one and there were 2 of us... I called the reception to ask for the newspaper and was told the one we wanted was not published during the weekend. I know very well it is. They finally got one for us. I asked them to prepare the room for two on the second evening. To no avail. Of course, this is nothing really serious, but it is precisely the kind of little simple things you expect in that category of hotel. At the least... When we left, I told the receptionist about the room not being prepared for 2. Â« Sorry. Â» That's it. While at the reception, we heard another customer saying the breakfast delivered to his room was in no way what he had asked for. He said that when he complained to the person who had brought the breakfast, he only got an Â« Oh! Â» comment and finally got what was missing, without a word of apology. Don't they ever listen to what the guests say? (And by the way, we had to listen to the amorous sighs and grunts and screams of our next-door neighbours on the 5th floor...)

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel, not great”
Reviews.Author: claudia525
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le St. James is a very good hotel in Montreal. It is not an excellent hotel. There were some very nice touches, some not so nice, and some where they just missed a bit. When I booked the hotel I mentioned more than once that it was our 30th Wedding anniversary. I have been away during other not so major anniversaries and ALWAYS received something from the staff. It would have been nice to get a bottle of champagne, some chocolates, flowers something that made it a personal experience for the guest. It is not that they had to, but in this class of hotel it should have been done. We had the package which included a continental breakfast in their upscale restaurant. We ordered coissants, taost and danish. After a 40 minute wait, the waiter came back embarrassed that we did not receive our breakfast and then reported sorry they just ran out of coissant!!! It was an awful breakfast of cold dry toast and coffee! This is from an upscale hotel!!! I have been fortunate enough to have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world and believe me the st. james was a dissapointment. When I told the front desk about the breakfast they were concerned, but that is it. I guess I have been spoiled, but if they did anything to make me feel better any little gesture I would have rated this hotel better. The rooms are nice, so is the bathroom, but the attitude has to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice except the bloody sheets”
Reviews.Author: Ale3940
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le St-James is such a pretty boutique hotel in a great area of Montreal--the old town. This was my first visit to Montreal (with a friend). The lobby area is lovely--with a gorgeous library-sitting room and a stylish bar in the restaurant. And there are some old-school touches at the Le Saint James, such as chocolates on the pillow at night and old-fashioned keys that you leave at the front desk when you go out. But. I do have two big complaints. First of all, the bloody sheet incident. I crawled into bed one night exhausted and didn't really look carefully at the bed. Until I noticed a blood drop on one side of the pillowcase and then on the other. And then saw there was fresh blood on the blanket (duvet cover) as well. In fact, there was a lot of blood on the bed! It must have been the housekeeper who had an accident during turn-down service? All I know is that I called the front desk to come change the sheets, and as housekeeping was not available at 2am, they sent the front desk clerk and another guy--neither of whom had ever made a hotel bed (they said). This was fine and got me through the night. Though I was VERY suprised that the hotel neither apologized nor gave me the night free when I spoke to them the next morning. My second complaint is small--I think I got the handicapped room because there was no bathtub, just a shower with a long rail and a wooden bench in it (it definitely looked designed as a handicapped room). Water in the shower sprayed ALL over the bathroom, no matter what I did...quite a mess and not relaxing. In the end, it was a fine hotel but they did not live up to their end of the bargain. For upwards of $400/night, there should not be bloody sheets!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loramay12
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the hotel for the second time and I am already booking a week-end in October.Aside from the fact that the hotel as well as the suites are beautiful,the service is unbelievable!!! Everyone from the front desk to the spa is incredibly nice. My experience at the spa was amazing( i definetly recommend the caviar facial),I felt like a princess.The staff at the restaurant(x0)are soooooooooo nice,service was amazing,very attentive!!! If you go you must ask for Samuel,he is extremely knowledgable and friendly.This definitely should be on your bucket list. We cannot wait to go back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LindaOakville
Reviews.Content: Impeccable, quiet, good service, excellent restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Romance after 35 years”
Reviews.Author: 47thanks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celibrated our 35th wedding aniversary at Hotel Le St-James this Septemeber. We have travelled extensively so it was a joy to stay at a Hotel so close to our home as we live in a suburb of Montreal. The Hotel has an "Amore Package" which includes a night in a beautifull room, a cocktail upon arrival, breakfast in the excellent restaurant XO, and a massage in their phenominal spa. Check out their website, and if you have chance try Hotel Le St-James. By the way, the Hotel is located in Beautiful Old Montreal and was it was fun to re-connect and be tourists in our ownwith fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy nice - the only hotel we'll stay in Montreal from this day forward!”
Reviews.Author: SFOtoJFK
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's the most expensive hotel in Montreal but the service, the charm and the suites are just spectacular. We booked using our Platinum AmEx card (you have to book online to get the benefits) and the benefits were great. 4pm check out. Check. $100 food/bev credit. Check. The best part was the upgrade to a suite. What an incredible room with 20 plus foot ceilings, a massive four post bed and a bathroom with 24 towels..gorgeous big seemingly brand new towels. Suite 301 (the Maxwell Suite) is on the third floor and is ultra private. Only two rooms on the floor, both are suites. The room was very Paris feeling and the bathroom was enormous with everything again just perfect. Downside...it's a super luxe five star hotel and the prices reflect that across the board. Our late night room service was very very good (veal steak, salmon, shrimp cocktail, massive onion soup, berries w/ cream) but it was half as much as our room for one night...again pricey but well worth it. We had drinks in the bar - very charming servers and the bartender took our "requirements" for drinks and created two top notch cocktails. Savoy worthy even. We had breakfast in XO - the service was good but not perfect. The food was good but again not perfect. Note to the kitchen...toast the muffin used in the Eggs Benedict or the muffin just turns into a soggy muffin. The decor in XO, well, you'll either love it or hate it. It's eclectic without a doubt but does have a feel of 1989 just a bit. The changing colored lights are interesting but too prominent. The large screen TV's, that's just a big azz mistake if you ask me. They do not belong anywhere in the public's view when you're in such a fine hotel and restaurant. Dare I say...they just look tacky hanging on the wall. If an event requires them, bring them up from storage. Overall - the people make the place and the room was delightful in a big grand way. You will know that it's something special the moment you walk in the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gin74italy
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, it's elegant, charming and very comfortable. We received an upgrade in a junior suite, it was very nice, renowed and with a large bathroom...I enjoied so much the big shower... The bed is probably the most comfortable in our life, simply fantastic. The XO restaurant is wonderful, we have spent three nights at the XO because we like too much this place. The staff is really kind and friendly, and the concierge, Mr. Eddy, help you in any way...thanks again Eddy!!! Value for money: excellent!

Reviews.Title: “All Accolades Deserved”
Reviews.Author: Beachbilly
Reviews.Content: We wanted a weekend get-away for our 40th wedding anniversary and picked Montreal. The Saint James was perfect for a special splurge occasion. All the accolades in prior reviews are well deserved. Staff knows what high-end friendly service is. World class. Two tips...(1) don't overlook the hotel restaurant XO. We had the tasting menu brunch on Saturday and it was super...and the room is high style elegant. We dropped in for night caps upon returning to the hotel at night and were well served. (2) If you are looking for the all-out 7 course tasting menu modern french meal, Toque is a one block walk from the hotel (and maybe Roger Federer and his wife will walk in when you are there too.)...its not cheap. Because housekeeping is extremely meticulous, don't expect access to your room before mid-afternoon when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Getsbic
Reviews.Content: This was a magnificent hotel; the staff was exceptional and delightful. We were treated like royalty. The location is outstanding, in the heart of old montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Simlo22
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, great location, the lobby restaurant is lovely, the maitre d' is actually very nice, and the concierge as well. The room was beautiful, just the number of bathtowels is impressive. Definitely more expensive than other hotels but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Loves2travel4444
Reviews.Content: My wife and I come here every time we go to Montreal! The service is what keeps us coming back every time, all of the staff is so attentive!

Reviews.Title: “Superb small hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: wmccfp
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Le St James and it was one of the most wonderful experiences we've had. The hotel is located on the edge of Old Montreal so it is within easy walking distance of many restaurants, shops and the waterfront. The hotel itself is an unimposing structure with only 60 rooms, each one of which is unique. Once you walk in your impression immediately changes. The entryway is a combination of small but spacious while on the immediate right is a marvellous library room. We had coffee, played chess (they supplied the board) and accessed wi-fi while in a genteel surrounding with an extensive collection of books both in French and English. Our first two nights were on the 11th floor where we had a well-equipped but not particularly spacious room with a queen size bed. The bathroom was medium size with a superb shower. As tall people we had requested a kingsize bed but through an administrative error were not given the correct room/bed. Once a kingsize bed/room was available they moved us to the 10th floor. This room was larger and had an even more spectacular shower (6 different shower heads including directly overhead that could be used in any combination desired). I don't believe any of the rooms have views of note. What we found most impressive was the willingness and dedication of every staffmember to do everything possible to make our stay pleasant. As regular guests at Ritz Carlton properties we're used to the highest levels of service. Le St. James went one step beyond. Perhaps it was the smallness that made it more personal. Breakfast in the lounge/bar/dining room was a delight. The menu was varied and over our stay we tried many different choices: all excellent. While we never had lunch or dinner at the Hotel we had drinks/wine in the early and late evenings. The intimate setting was relaxing. The wine list is good but not extensive. The gym (in the basement along with the spa) is very small with two treadmills and two stationary bikes with a limited amount of free weights. If you want to do anything but basic cardio work you'll be disappointed. We've stayed in a number of hotels where the physical room/appointments were superior to Le St James but only a couple where the overall experience matched it. If you're looking for highly personal service in an intimate setting you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: killer_and_the_girl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at Le St James Hotel. It was a perfect location to Old Montreal and the Notre Dame Basillica. We booked our stay through Tavelocity and got a 10% off coupon code. Originally w didn't consider the St James, but with a discount on the room it became very affordable. The rooms were beautiful and well maintained. The bathroom was very large with marble floors and tub. They provide internet access in the library, which we continued to use in our room. We didn't eat at XO Restaurant, but had drinks at the bar. The bartender was very pleasant and made a great chocolate martini. The bed was comfortable and the room had excellent AC (90 degrees outside). Ate breakfast at Eggspectation, one block up the street, and next door at the Intercontinental Hotel. Highly recommend and will return

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel that unfortunately leaves guests feeling overcharged”
Reviews.Author: ctsai1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le St-James is a beautiful hotel situated in an ideal location in the old part of town. The staff is caring and the concierge excellent. While our four-night stay would have left a most pleasurable memory, we encountered several recurring problems in the hotel's dining room, XO Restaurant. Continental Breakfast was included in our room rate, and regardless of whether or not a Continental Breakfast was ordered, we were assured at check-in a credit of its value to be applied to the check. Strangely, however, we were billed for the Continental Breakfast, in addition, to juice, tea and cereal, even though we did not order the Continental Breakfast. Our breakfast, therefore, wound up being a cost. Another couple who sat next to us encountered the same problem. Despite having raised the issue with the general manager and the front desk, the problem reoccurred each morning. It baffles us why Hotel Le St-James would want to bill in this manner and leave guests with a feeling of being overcharged when Hotel Le St-James could offer guests a truly memorable experience and encourage repeat visits. If visiting Montreal, I recommend choosing a different hotel, like Hotel Place D'Armes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SEE1981
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel near the Old town in Montreal. It is a charming old hotel, but the best feature is the service provided by their front desk staff, the concierge desk and spa. Ask Eddie at the concierge desk for advice on an Asian restuarant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great food. Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Dash22
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was perfect, the rooms were amazing(as a family we had 3, 301, 1002, 1006)service was fantastic, restaurant was fantastic, bathrooms were new and very clean. Only complaint was that U2 was staying in the hotel when we were and their security was a little over board and the $20 a day for internet was ridiculous for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, I loved it”
Reviews.Author: miss_r_jones
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sheer elegance, beautifully decorated with antiques. My room was very clean and absolutely stunning, with a huge bathroom and a rain shower. The toiletries were Molton Brown and there was even lavendar sleep spray by the bed. There was a beautiful library in which delicious complimentary coffee was served in the mornings. I had been a bit worried it would be snooty but the staff were all utterly charming and made me feel very welcome. The only downside was that the restaurant was very expensive (unsurprisingly, although I would be surprised if it wasn't fantastic), so I didn't eat in the hotel. Had breakfasts at Eggspectation down the road (turn left when leaving the hotel), which was alright. I was on a business trip, would love to go back for a holiday with my boyfriend because it would be really romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff without equal. Thank you. Restaurant (XO), good, but there is opportunity for improvement”
Reviews.Author: syncopation1234
Reviews.Content: As this was our first experience in a â€œboutiqueâ€� hotel, so this comment is for those who might wish to â€œsplurgeâ€� occasionally. Like most things, it is the â€œlittle touchesâ€� which, when added up, can either make you utterly delighted (or leave you somewhat disappointed). On balance, we were very happy with this hotel. Strengths: Impeccable service (valet, concierge, front desk, bellhop). Every one very cheerful, witty and â€œon their gameâ€�. Immaculate room, nice â€œboutiqueâ€� accoutrements: artwork and chandeliers in the halls. Rooms had lovely vases, chairs, amazing fixtures in bathroomâ€¦ Nice little touches, like an invitation to a complimentary cocktail at XO (they make an excellent gin martini, by the way)â€¦. Opportunities for improvement: XO restaurant â€“breakfast. Breakfast came to $60+ for two, ahem, yes, we decided to splurge â€“ so at this price you pretty much expect perfection, right? â€¦ hmmmm, well not quite what we got. Despite the hospitable greeting and the magnificent dÃ©cor, the service and bussing of the tables was very slow. (We noticed other couples seated near us who seemed impatient too). The food, when it came, was not piping hot (we respectively had eggs Benedict and oatmeal) â€“ quality was â€œsort of OKâ€�, and if we waited another 10 minutes before eating the food, it would have been stone cold. Coffee and juices (for the price paid) â€“ not the highest quality. E.g. there were coffee grounds in the coffee, the waiter brought us cream, instead of the milk that we had specified when he asked us â€¦ just a little sloppy. Again, see comment on the â€œlittle thingsâ€�, above. If a restaurant is catering to the country club or expense account set, the above would be minor irritants. To those who choose to â€œsplurgeâ€� only occasionally, it leaves you wondering why you spent so much money and got what was basically an average breakfast in spite of wonderful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MarshaSk
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. The room was very comfortable and oh so beautiful. The bathroom was all white marble and the shower had a separate dial for temperature control that you could calibrate to the celsius degree, and another for water volume. So many small and thoughtful details like that. It was expensive but a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: RafeNewYork
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for a weekend and wanted to stay in Old Montreal. The hotel was perfectly situated within walking distance from restaurants, shops and the old town. The service was attentive and prompt. We ordered room service for breakfast and the food arrived a few minutes early. They also have a great restaurant bar for cocktails. The rooms are very comfortable with a nifty little touch pad that controls the lights within arms length without making too much of an effort.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at Le St. James”
Reviews.Author: Chellco
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Hotel Le St. James with family over the Easter holiday. We booked this hotel after our scheduled vacation to Budapest fell through at the last minute. In light of this disappointment, I was thoroughly prepared to dislike this hotel; however, it was impossible not to fall in love with this first class establishment, as well as the city of Montreal. From the moment we arrived at Le St. James, we were treated like royalty. Upon our arrival at the hotel (by car), the concierge unloaded and parked our vehicle (there is a separate fee for parking) within the blink of an eye. Check-in was just as smooth, and it was only a matter of minutes before we were fully ensconsed within our room -- a junior suite that was exceptionally roomy and clean, and included all of the basics (flat screen television, speakers, safe and minibar). The bathroom had a bath and separate shower, and my daughter and I loved all of the bath products (particularly the body cream and sleep mist). The hotel, a former bank, is classy and elegantly furnished. A reading room off the lobby is extremely comfortable, and houses a Mac computer with free wi-fi access (there is a $20 charge for wi-fi access in the rooms, which I do find unnecessary) as well as newspapers, magazines and books (all of the great classics). Le St. James has a spa (which I did not have the opportunity to utilize) as well as a small fitness center. The fitness center houses two treadmills, an elliptical machine, several stationary bicycles and some weights. Although small, the fitness center was more than adequate, and I never had to wait for a machine or to use the weights. We had the opportunity to dine at XO, the hotel restaurant. Although pricy, the food was excellent and the wait staff more than accomodating. We also ordered room service during our stay, which was delicious, albeit expensive (our turkey club and coffee came to $50, with taxes and service charges). At this point, I must note that everyone employed at the St. James went out of their way to ensure that we had a fanastic stay in both the hotel and in Montreal. The staff at the front desk was wonderful throughout the duration of our visit. The concierge went out of his way to prepare a full itinerary for us, complete with restaurant recommendations (all of which were fabulous, particularly Barroco for dinner, and Olive & Gourmando and Eggspectations for breakfast/lunch). Even the housekeeping staff expressed concern about our comfort, and made sure to give my daughter extra chocolates during the nightly turn down service (which were especially appreciated by a certain 10 year old). Le St. James is centrally located within Old Montreal (or Vieux-Montreal, as it is called by the locals). Most of the sites that we visited were accessible on foot, and those that were further (ie. the Biodome, Botanical Gardens, Complexe Desjardins) could be reached by taxi or train. A few additional points ... Le St. James does take pets (for an additional fee). Although I chose to leave my canine companions at home, I did see other guests with dogs in the hotel lobby. Also, if traveling to Le St. James by car (and you are relying upon a navigational system), please be aware that there are two 355 Rue Saint Jacques (the address of the hotel) in Montreal. The address that we arrived at first was an abandoned building; however, when I plugged the name of the hotel into my navigational system (instead of relying upon the address alone), I was immediately directed to the correct location. Anyway, all in all, I cannot do anything but rave about Le St. James. I have traveled a lot over the years for business and pleasure, and very few hotels have made me feel as special as Le St. James. I am already planning my next trip back to Montreal this summer ... and you can be sure that I will be staying at Le St. James.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRJESQ
Reviews.Content: The Le St-James is a beautiful and luxurious hotel. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed with mammoth king sized beds and large flat screen TVs. All in all very comfortable. Unfortunately, there are no connecting rooms. This was a minor inconvenience when traveling with family. Beautiful lobby and dining room. Service was top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Concierge almost makes up for Bad Amenities and $6.00 Coffee to Go”
Reviews.Author: peterbnewyork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend in Montreal, and were disappointed in the level of amenities provided in this five-star hotel. We anticipated that there would be a comfortable lounge with multiple seating areas and service for drinks or light appetizers, and instead there was a shabby "library" adjacent to the drafty main entrance, which served as a waiting room for guests checking in. Not a place you want to sit and have a drink. There is not really a lounge in this hotel at all. The fitness center was promoted as being "state of the art" although there was one treadmill, one weight machine, and a couple of other pieces of equipment in a basement room. The "spa" is one treatment room with stone walls, and there are zero amenities available to hotel guests. The steam room is really just a steam shower, and you cannot access this unless you have purchased a treatment in that room. There is not even a bathroom at the spa level, nor is anyone sitting at the desk unless they are waiting for an appointment. My wife found this basement area to be creepy, and I found it to be nowhere near a five-star level. The breakfast included with our booking turned out to be a continental breakfast only, which was adequate for us, but perhaps not for someone else - lesser value than I expected. I was particularly insulted, however, by the fact that I was charged $6.00 for a cup of regular coffee in a take-out cup. I came to the lobby early in the morning looking to bring coffee upstairs while I did some work, and was astounded at the nerve of the hotel charging this much for coffee - they need to get a clue from the Four Seasons about service - free coffee in the morning is five-star - this was not. This charge for the coffee was consistent with the $20 per day WiFi charge we were compelled to pay - let's get real about service - free internet is service-oriented, charging for it, let alone $20 per day for it, is not. Other than these complaints, the room was very nice and comfortable, and the hotel location was great. What nearly made up for the hotel's shortcomings was the excellent concierge staff, particularly Simon, who were so accommodating and knowledgeable about what we New Yorkers would want to do and see. They sent us for an incredible meal at Barroco, which really made our trip, and were so informative and responsive. Overall, we will never stay at this hotel again and I do not consider it to be a five-star hotel, although the staff was well-trained and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Beautiful rooms - Allows Dogs”
Reviews.Author: CAShirey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over New Year's eve weekend and it was wonderful. We made a reservation for the New Year's even dinner at XO restaurant and the food was amazing (although I have to say that the chair was not as comfortable as I would have liked). We stayed in a Jr. Suite and the room was beautifully decorated with a small but luxurious bathroom with nice tub and seperate shower. The best part for us was that they allowed us to bring our dog and even set up the cutest dog bed and bowls for him in the room. Its hard to find hotels as nice as this one that welcome pets. We also had treatments in the spa and although the massage was just OK, the rooms were worth it, very unique and we got our own private room with sauna, shower, and steam room to get ready in. The location was about a 7-10 minute walk to the main shopping/eating area and there are a few nice bistro style restaurants closer (highly recomment Holder Restaurant). The concierge, reception and valet were all super attentive and very welcoming at all times. The only minor complaint I had was that the room was really hot and even though we had control over the temperature, the room would just not cool off. We ended up opening windows and it was fine after that.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was the Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Magpie1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove to Montreal from Southern New York the day after Christmas with three adult children ages 20, 24 and 26 for a two night stay. In deciding on a hotel, I spent weeks trying to figure out whether it would be worth the cost of the rooms at the St. James since there were so many hotel bargains being offered. The bottom line, it was worth it. Everyone just loved being at the hotel. In fact, it was difficult to get the girls out of the rooms. When you figure in the money spent on other things like dinners, drinks and entertainment, the cost of the room where you spend most of your time was a reasonable expense. We walked to the Point Vieux Port ice skate each day, then a leisurely lunch. The girls loved the beautiful, spacious, well-appointed bathrooms with radiant heated floors, wonderful beds, beautiful linens, luxurious amenities, flat screen TVs and comfortable bedroom furnishings. We ate out each night at great restaurants within easy walking distance. The first night the "children" wanted Mexican. I am thinking I did not come all this way for Mexican food, but in the interest of family harmony quickly agreed. We walked three blocks to an outstanding meal at Casa de Mateo. The next night, Le Bonaparte served us another extraordinary meal. The Hotel restaurant is in the former grand bank's main room. The children would have like breakfast choices at 11:30 a.m., but were limited to dinner type entrees and $22 hamburgers. My lunch of PEI oysters, sliced steak and apple/pear tart with walnut ice cream was delicious. Had I told the concierge what we wanted, however, I am certain he would have directed us outside, but I wished to experience all of the Hotel and so I chose to eat in. The value wasn't there. By contrast my son and I had a beer the first night in the library off the main entrance and sat by the fire reading the days papers. Even at $10 a beer it was worth it as we sat there eating the chilled free clementines. Each evening we would return to our rooms after dinner to find clean linen mats by our bed, new complimentary slippers, chocolates and bottles of water on each side of the bed. The doormen, concierge and the receptionist staff were all very friendly and welcoming. The bottom line is my wife and children think of our hotel stay as the best Christmas present I could have given them and that is exactly what I was hoping for. Travel is all about the experience and this was a great one for our family. I will do it again, particularly since the drive is so easy. For reference, we like places like Tuckers Point Club, The Greenbrier and Sea Island.

Reviews.Title: “City trip Montreal at St. James”
Reviews.Author: Storm00
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding experience! Montreal is a great city to explore for a few days! St. James is THE hotel in this city to stay. Big rooms, excellent service and great food! Thanks St. James for a great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: scantx
Reviews.Content: Although very pricey, this hotel is worth every bit of it! From check in to check out, we were pampered & well taken care of. Restuarant was excellent, rooms were very nice, amenities were outstanding & the staff was top notch! Great breakfast place down the street that others have recommended, Eggspecation, is good but very crowded. Go early. This hotel is w/in walking distance to all things in Old Montreal. After staying here, how could we stay elsewhere in Old Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “stunningly quaint”
Reviews.Author: Kathy1725raintree
Reviews.Content: We were treated as if we were royalty.All staff was so friendly.Any need expressed was met(ie:2 favorite newspapers per day).The hotel and rooms were beautifully appointed.Honestly, I did miss an in room coffee machine but....the room was so comfortable it made up for the lack of A.M. coffee. Room service brought it but for a charge. Hotel is very convenient to walking the city. Conceirge was so very professional and helpful. Loved the Old World elegance. We were disappointed in the XO restaurant's menu..not elegant or gourmet enough for us.Would definiely stay again and recommend to our friends.A Garden of Eden on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Little Paris”
Reviews.Author: BillyG9
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and staff. Food O.K. Sightseeing average. Cute

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS CLASSY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: NEWLYRETIRED100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous -- breathtaking -- old world charm, decor, service, staff -- everything is perfection. We are here for 2 days (three nights) -- my husband and I feel we could just move in and be very happy. We have a junior suite beautifully decorated, wonderful amenities, spotlessly clean - couldn't ask for more. And I am not easy to please! Everything about the hotel is high end - it is steps to the art galleries and shopping in old Montreal - also convenient to downtown-- if we ever visit Montreal again, we will stay here, without question..

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, fantastic location, interesting service”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...what shall I say? I very much wanted to absolutely love this place but there were a few uncomfortable circumstances. The architecture and design both inside and out are sublime. This place exudes a unique sense of classic elegance and beauty. Our rooms were both spacious, corner locations that contained every amenity imagineable. The decor was a tad dated but every inch of the room was impeccably, spottlessly clean...love that! There was a pretentiousness in the air and the attitude and disposition of several staff was snobbish and rude. FIX THIS PROBLEM, PLEASE ! All but these few were beyond compare! The doorman, the concierge, the housekeeping ladies, our XO waiter....absolutely a JOY to be in their presence! They truly made our stay an experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: dannyboy2_10
Reviews.Content: We had a splendid stay at this small, intimate hotel. It is quite luxurious -- the entrance, the library, and the rooms. The restaurant is extremely expensive, but since you are located right in the center of Old Montreal, there are many good restaurants within walking distance, as well as breakfast places a few yards away. Our room was lovely, the bathroom and shower wonderful, the bed extremely comfortable, and there was no street noise. The concierge desk provides great service. For a two-night vacation, we were pleased we paid the higher cost for a wonderful stay at this perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what is the high rate for?”
Reviews.Author: gc914
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted to really splurge for our day in Montreal. Most of the reviews were very good. Unfortunately, we were greatly disappointed. We arrived at 2;30 check in was 4 so we had lunch in the restaurant. Not very good at all.. very expensive. we went to front desk a 3:30 and were told that room was not ready but housekeeping would call back. we waited right there until way after 4 when we asked again. The front desk attitude was that we should be glad she was talking to us and yes, the room was now ready. Why didn't they let us know? The room was nothing special and small. Two small chairs and no way to watch TV from the bed. After dinner we went to the lounge to use the complimentary drink coupons the hotel gave us. They looked at them as if they were trash and told us if we wanted to use them it would only be good for the hotel drink of the day. I will say the concierge was a wonderful person. Friendly and helpful and the only one on the staff like that. So..not a good restaurant, not such a good room, and not even good service so what is the high room rate for?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing missing!”
Reviews.Author: hillymd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days for our first year anniversary. It was our first trip to Montreal. We LOVED the St. James! The rooms are beautiful - well-furnished, quiet, nice beds, GREAT BATHROOM with 4-star shower, and more.. Fantastic service. Great dining room (we got our breakfast included - they say continental is what is included, but they let us order whatever we wished). Nice location in Old Montreal - we were glad we chose this area vs. downtown. We cannot wait to return. Amazing spa, too.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Magnifique and Mais Tres,Tres Cher”
Reviews.Author: Upperwestsider
Reviews.Content: Lovely old hotel with devine service but soooo expensive. The cost does not match the value of the room. We were upgraded from a Junior Suite to a Superior Suite - it was a smallish and dark room, no view and little air circulation. But we requested a floor lamp so we could read - it arrived quickly. The service is wonderful and friendly. A fantastic bathroom and excellent shower, and plenty of towels. We did request turn-down service both nights but never got it...oh well. We ordered a la carte for breakfast and it cost $70 - grapefruit, toast, a slice of cheese, and coffee? Goodness. But the dining room is beautiful and worth the experience. There is a small fitness room and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location for the older family members. Youngsters stay closer to the Bell Centre.”
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for a night, but thought everything about the hotel was fantastic. Beautiful and clean. Great decor and quality bathroom. No problems at all. The staff are friendly and helpful. The younger members of the group are better off staying up closer to the Bell Centre for the bars, restaurants and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: PCVM
Reviews.Content: Quiet, comfortable, and elegant hotel with warm service

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DottoreTomasso
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Wonderful staff. Tip: Justaposed between old and new Montreal. They were out of all rooms except Junior Suites and up. I told them I did not want to pay more than X and they quoted a slightly higher rate and upgraded us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, avoid room service”
Reviews.Author: alphornmama
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hotel Le St. James in Montreal in an adjoining room-plus-suite. The hotel was really cool, with the kind of boutique hotel decor that I really like: dark and cozy and plush. I like that the rooms are all different too - ours were decorated very nicely - a bit dark though. It always seemed like it was about 6pm, but Le St. James is a downtown hotel in the old quarter of the city, so this is to be expected. The bathrooms were very nice - big tub in one of them which I always appreciate. The hotel restaurant is expensive but delicious - we all really loved our meal there. Had a bit of a communication problem sometimes but that is Montreal. Service was also above the average, but not by much. I did think the people at the front desk were friendly enough. The standouts were: The concierge, Eddy Amoroso. He is a wonderful concierge. He organized a few things for us that I couldn't do myself, and he did that wonderfully. Thank you Eddy! The spa. I went for a massage because I wanted to see the bank vault that the spa is located inside. I am so glad I did! It was really something special, and the masseuse was a very capable lady, so I left quite happy. The room service was disappointing, verging on horrible. We are room service junkies, so I know more or less how things should go, but I felt pretty bad for these fellows and for myself because it was very expensive (as always), but they always managed to forget something: coffee cream, cutlery (yes, can you believe it?), a meal, etc. The worst of all was when we wanted to order a dessert after a nice day out. We ordered a brownie and a sundae. It took over an hour to arrive, (our son fell asleep so no dessert for him), and the brownie was so burnt on the bottom that I actually had to spit it out of my mouth. It was literally charred! I didn't bother to complain because it was so late. All in all, it was a pleasant stay, but I think I might check out other hotels in Montreal before I went back again just because it was pretty expensive for what it was. But it was worth a visit, certainly. The neighborhood is funky, but there are a LOT of homeless men walking around the general area... I did get a fantastic blowout from a hair salon around the corner called Leopolds. He was so gentle with my hair! It was a nice experience, in case anyone needs great hair in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “This was a beautiful hotel with impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: fussytraveller066
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many five star hotels, but none with service as good as at the Hotel Le St. James. From the doormen, to the front desk clerk (and the absolutely beautiful room keys - not plastic cards) and to the restaurant servers - nothing was lacking. I felt as though I was their most important guest. Very different from the next night when I stayed at the Chateau Laurier in Ottawa, though I usually am a fan of Fairmonts. I stayed in a junior suite which was very large and had very, very good amenities. Every detail was very well done. No scrapes on the walls or dust on the furniture. The bathroom was spacious with a separate and immaculately clean tub and very nice shower. I am a sound sensitive person and did not hear a peep from outside the room, though I was close to an elevator. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Divine.”
Reviews.Author: LaPrimaDonna
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was simply divine, I have nothing bad to say about it what-so-ever. It's gorgeous, and it has very well-trained staff, and the food is amazing. It's ramontic elegance, with modern chic added in. Exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Luxury Accomodations and Service.”
Reviews.Author: Rugger64
Reviews.Content: Simply superb! Couldn't ask for better service or more comfortable accomodations. My wife loved the Molten Brown bath products, our suite was spacious and melded the old and new seamlessly. Situated in an old bank building, Le Saint James features high ceilings (12 feet?) and period architectural details combined with modern amenities...and it all works spectacularly. Well worth the stay, especially if you can get a deal for a little more than $200/night, as we did. And, the hotel's restaurant, XO, is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, but also ultramodern”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: This building is grand, intimate and old. But it is so completely renovated. For example, in the room by every phone there is a master controller for all of the lights, temperature, etc., so you don't have to get out of bed to control the temperature. The room is really spacious with very tall ceilings and ornate molding is everywhere. But the decor isn't victorian or dated, it's like if you combined a W hotel with a Fairmont. It's rated four star, but I think it's a five star. Especially the spa. When I got to the spa, the therapist said, "we'll be going into the vault". The massage room is literally inside a safe, but it's not claustrophobic. There is a lit floor (lighting is dim and amber) and the walls are really aged brick. It's the best spa I've ever experienced in terms of cool. Pricing is extremely reasonable for what you get. Room service is fast and accurate. The potatoes would be my only complaint but big deal. Oh the restaurant is spectacular. Huge, ornate staircase and opera balconies, but with neon lighting effects where the colors blend and change every few minutes. That restaurant would be a great place to have a wedding or reception. This is just a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatWV
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the St James for 2 days after a cruise. We shared a room on the 7th floor for $200 a night through Expedia. The room was lovely with upscale amenities such as slippers, robes, heated marble floors in the bath and evening turndown service with chocolates. The beds are comfortable with a down cover and soft pillows. Our room did not have a bathtub and the shower, while large has an annoying lightweight curtain that wraps itself around your wet body as you shower. Breakfast was expensive $32 for lox and bagels with coffee and juice. A better solution is the Eggspectations Restaurant down the street for $8. The hotel is located close to the museum, shopping, and the Old City. Coffee and tea are available in the morning with newspapers in the library. The bar is lovely at night with lights that change that highlight the high ceiling. On the negative side, I found the traffic noise from the windows in our room irritating and the front desk failed to tell us that we needed to leave our key in the morning at the desk or we would not have room service. I needed to use the Internet for a web conference and found the codes for access did not work. While the correct codes were finally found by calling the service provider it took 20 minutes before the manager was able to get the issue resolved. The Internet is free and is fast. If you need to do any business while in Montreal I would stay somewhere else as the hotel is not equipped for business travelers (or they do not expect you to do business). The bell men are wonderful and attentive in handling luggage and answering questions.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular across the board”
Reviews.Author: styxx85
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time hailing a cab when we left on Sunday; no problem, one of the doorman ran down to a busier street, hailed a cab, got in it and rode it back to the hotel for us. Talk about service. The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are huge & elegant, but with all the modern conveniences you would expect from a top end hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The restaurant XO, if oddly outsized in proportion to the hotel is beautiful, and we could have easily spent all afternoon there drinking wine and relaxing. The hotel has a very private feel to it which explains why it is favored by celebrities, of which one was staying while we were there. While we didnâ€™t love Montreal we would return for the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: That is the only word that can come close to describing the experience of this fabulous hotel. There can no possibly be another hotel to compare with the charm, refinement, service and staff attitude than at Le St-James. The staff actually thinks and anticipates your requests. Rooms a generously sized .. bath is perfect and quality and selection of amenities are excellent. Small breakfast buffet is perfect and ambience is better. You will not have enjoyed Montreal if you do not stay at this gem. We paid about $200 and I have never been as satisfied nor have I been as reluctant to leave a hotel. We will be back! don.brown@brownchild.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: llams
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here 2 nights in September for our anniversary. The service is truly remarkable; the staff are all professional and courteous. The building is beautiful and our room was very nice. We stayed in one of their basic rooms and found it to be quite large and comfortable. The bathroom was roomy with a separate tub and large shower with multiple shower heads and great water pressure. The dining room was closed for renovations so we didn't eat at the hotel (it re-opened the day after we left). We had a couples massage and I highly recommend their spa experience. The spa is beautiful and the atmosphere truly one of the best I've experienced. The location of the hotel is quite central to all. We live in the Montreal area and knew we could walk to most attractions, restaurants we wanted to visit. It was expensive but you do get what you pay for here. The one item I found a bit off was the amount they charged for parking but it would not deter me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty, fabulous hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: tateva
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived for our weekend getaway, the door was promptly opened for us by a man who looked as elegant and ceremonious as a Buckingham Palace guard but shared a gracious smile with me. We were dressed casually ( very casually!!) but we were treated exactly as well as the other guests who were dressed impeccably and on their way to the penthouse. This was just the introduction to one of the most delightful relaxing weekends I have had in years! We were spoiled- all of the staff spoke to us by name and any questions, or more importantly, recommendations and reservations for dining or entertainment were taken care of for us by the very approachable concierge. Turndown was perfect, our room was kept impeccable and I have not slept as deeply as I did this weekend since before I had children! This was an A++++++

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Small Hotel in Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: DRace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It is small and tucked away on a busy corner, but boy does it have a lot to offer. Starting with the doorman Martin, all the way through the entire staff, this hotel aims to please. The lobby is elegant and offers tea and coffee in a gorgeous library. The rooms were amazing -- large and decorated with very old world style in keeping with the building and sleekly modern skillfully mixed in. The bathrooms were stunning with one of the best showers I have ever had. I also understand the restaurant is one of the best in Montreal. Unfortunately it was closed for renovations on our visit, but looked like an extraordinary room and is said to have fabulous cuisine. And the spa is worth a trip even if you opt not to have a treatment there -- it is a gorgeous room worthy of a picture on its own. The hotel is located in proximity to several wonderful restaurants and sightseeing areas. I cannot say enough about this hotel ,and while our stay was short, I plan to rectify that and return for a longer stay to better enjoy the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: BIGPHUN
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the St.James for 3 nights. Very friendly, courteous staff . I paid a little over $200/night on Expedia, a relative bargain for this hotel. I also received a much appreciated upgrade to a junior suite which was a very nice room. The restaurant in the lobby of the hotel is closed and under construction for another few weeks which is probably why the rooms were inexpensive. No matter. The only time you heard noise from the construction was in the lobby at the front desk which is right near the entrance to the restaurant. I don't know if noise can be heard from the lower floors in the hotel as I was up on a higher floor. Check with the hotel regarding this. The hotel's 5 star status does draw a little "snobby" type of customer, but that is expected. The only problem we encountered was the first night we couldn't get the room to cool off properly although the a/c was turned way down. The hotel sent someone up and unlocked the windows which solved the problem. The other nights the air in the rooms was fine.All in all, great hotel,especially if you can "steal" a room for under$250/night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: willy_779
Reviews.Content: Everything was lovely!!! Rooms & Decor was absolutly marvelous. Best Housekeeping staff I have ever seen...People are very welcoming and are always there to help you. I will defenitly recommend this property for all business travelers and leisure travelers. The rooms are very spacious with vibrant decor and outstanding amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique luxury, but a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Kikik1234
Reviews.Content: The only negatives at this hotel were the check-in staff, and no one told us the XO Restaurant would be closed during our visit, so the breakfasts were spartan to say the least. WHen we arrived, our room wasn't ready & I asked the front desk where the bathroom was - the Asian woman there informed me that the restrooms were closed for renovation, and I'd have to go down the street to find a bathroom. I explained I was 8 months pregnant, yet she did nothing to help me. She could have just told me to go downstairs & use the one at the spa. Other than that, the rooms are superb - luxurious, unique, with great artwork & comfortable beds. The concierges are top-notch & went out of their way to help us. The bell boys & valet were also excellent as were the maids.

Reviews.Title: “Fatou is my HERO!”
Reviews.Author: lmay
Reviews.Content: I had the opposite experience of the previous reviewer. Fatou could not have been more helpful and was kind and considerate and sent emails within seconds of our conversations. She secured a room for us for our 20th anniversary when the hotel was completely booked for several of the days of our stay. I cannot thank her enough for her helpfulness. She had no reason whatsoever to be so accommodating but chose to be exceedingly helpful. For that, I am eternally grateful. Our anniversary celebration was perfect and Fatou was instrumental in that. We had a few problems with the wireless internet access which shouldn't have been a big deal except we were there to attend the Canadian Open and needed to access the schedule each day which is available only online. The concierge, Simon, went to extraordinary measures to help us obtain the schedules. Both concierges we encountered were unbelievably helpful. We were not thrilled with the restaurant recommendations of Boris Bistro and it's sister restaurant, Harvey; however, both were adequate. All meals that we had in Montreal seemed to be sub par for the value. We had a few very nice meals but all were VERY expensive compared to similar meals in the states, even NYC. Our two favorite meals were at Le Latini and Le Locale, both within walking distance of the hotel. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant but did use the WC after checking out and before our flight home and were very impressed with the facilities. When I am Roger Federer, I will hire the interior designer that came up with the decor in those restrooms! The subway was just a block away from the hotel so very convenient. It was extrememly safe (as was all of Montreal that we could see) , clean and simple to navigate--color coded just like the Paris metro. The accommodations (Room 605) were spectacular, the room, five star. I believe the room we were in was a step above standard. There was a special anniversary treat waiting for us when we arrived. The housekeeping staff were invisible, from a.m. clean up to turn down service. Two problems with the room were that the tv was so far from the bed that the remote did not work from the bed. We forgave this inconvenience because we didn't need to be watching TV on this trip and most channels were in French. Also, had we spent less time at tennis and more time sightseeing around the hotel I would have been disappointed that there was no real lounge to sit around in sipping cocktails and people- watching. There is a beautiful library with cocktail service from the restaurant but I never saw another person in there so it would have been more like having a cocktail in our room. The bathroom was 5 star and the shower was extraordinary. There was no bathtub which was fine with us. We never saw or heard another guest on our floor in the four days we visited, though the hotel was fully booked. In regard to the complaints about windows and light, we left early each morning and arrived back late each night so the windows really weren't of much value. I believe we had 3 heavily-draped windows in our room and one in the bathroom, all facing other buildings, but it just wasn't an issue for us. I knew in advance, from reading previous reviews, that I needed to bring higher wattage light bulbs and didn't bother. The light and make up mirror in the bathroom were just fine. The bed was five star with white Frett-style linens, sumptuously comfortable. We were overwhelmed with the beauty, comfort and hospitality afforded by this hotel and will return again, God willing. Thank you to the entire staff and especially to Fatou.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Incompetence”
Reviews.Author: lola123
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at le St-James 3 years earlier, so we thought we would stay again for our night off without the kids. I read about a Montrealer special rate on a trusted website , so i called the hotel. I was transfered to reservations, who had heard nothing of this package.they asked that i call the hotel directly the next day. The next day, after being transfered 3 times, I spoke to Fatou, who said she had never heard of this package, then said it wasn't available yet, but that she could get me a good rate. I booked a deluxe room for 220$. After browsing online, i found the specific details of the package , so I called back to give them the details. Fatou agreed to all I said, but she still had no idea what the package was. So she added breakfast , and offered reservations to XO , the hotel restaurant, which I declined. As i had not received her previous confirmation by email, she said she would send a second email. Two hours after this, i finally got her first email. The reservation was for the wrong date. I called back to complain : not only did they not know the packages they offered, they got my reservation wrong ! I was transfered to Malika's voice mail. I left her a message to inform her of the situation. She called me back, apologising, saying that the services I had gotten were certainly not up to a 5 star hotel ! I agreed, and she gave me an upgrade and changed the date on my reservation. THEN she called me back again, stating that the restaurant was to be closed on the day of my stay, for remodeling. That, by the way, was not mentionned on the website. She offered a free brunch voucher , olr that I could keep the inroom breakfast on a limited menu. She did not know what the menu would be however . So 2 days before the restaurant closes, management has no idea what their menu for room service will be ? She offered to call me back with menu details , so i said yes. I was trying to get a reservation for 1 night, not plan a wedding ! So here we are, the next day, still no call back ! I just called to cancvel my reservation, no one was sorry, no one cares ! Granted, I am a small client. But i think my situation says a lot about how the hotewl is run!

Reviews.Title: “Service par excellance!”
Reviews.Author: lindasp1962
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at Hotel le St-James, and from the minute I arrived in the taxi, The doorman/bellman were right on the ball, addressed me by name after just reading my luggage tag, and I was always addressed by my name from then on out by everyone of the staff. I got a room upgrade to a suite, and WOW! Fantastic suite, and the cleanliness was amazing! Everything was cleaned and polished and well presented in the room and bathroom. A welcome note and chocolates awaited me, after being showed to the room by Christine who kindly showed me things in the room, how they worked etc. and immediatly got some ice for me and some information I had requested about the Spa. The Concierge set up a dinner reservation for me, and presented the info. and address on a card for my convenience. This hotel is definitely top-notch with glamorous decor, fantastic service and great location .

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: anydog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a most incredible stay at the St-James. We went for two days just to get away and relax and to enjoy some great food and wine. The hotel, which used to be a bank, is located in Old Montreal so we were within walking distance of the port, shopping and restaurants. The jewel however is the XO Restaurant right there at the hotel. Chef Mike is an amazing young talent who prepared us a tasting menu that was beyond comparison. Every detail was attended to at the hotel from the moment we arrived until we left. We plan on returning again in the fall and hopefully stay for longer than two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat the food”
Reviews.Author: Viajadorita
Reviews.Content: The staff are generally very congenial and attentive, though we were disappointed by the misinformation given to us by the travel desk about local museums (i.e. hours of operation). The hotel's restaurant, XO, has a very strange sense of decor (almost fake-sophistication) and the enormous letters "X" and "O" bizarrely stand in the center of the dining space. The food was utterly disappointing and not of 5-star caliber. We breakfasted in the restaurant each of the 3 morning we were at the hotel, but it was merely for convenience's sake. A previous review that noted items on the adults' room service menu were strange was spot-on; the dishes had very strong, distinct flavors that ruined otherwise simple dishes/plates. Both my fiancÃ© and I were disappointed with the sandwiches we ordered (just a burger!), in addition to the desserts. You're certainly not getting what you pay for in terms of cuisine. The room was very comfortable and we really had a great short vacation in Montreal. The hotel is very close to a Metro station, which was perfect for our day trips around the heart of the city. Overall, very pleased with the experience at Le St.-James...I'd just recommend dining elsewhere whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: worldwidewanderer93
Reviews.Content: My wife grew up in Montreal, we return frequently and have stayed in a good many of the top hotels. Friends who live in Montreal advised that the best in the city is the St. James. We found it to be exactly that. First rate in every respect. You will not be disappointed. Best restaurants? Toque - 2 minutes walk. Le Pimet Rouge - 15 minutes. Boris Bistro - 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every way!”
Reviews.Author: poohbear6103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our long weekend to Montreal where we stayed at the Hotel Le St. James. What a great experience! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by our names. We were given a Junior Suite that was absolutely beautiful and appreciated being escorted to the room and having all the amenities explained. The only thing I could fault with the room is the small window, but it is a historical building and that is how it was made. Other than that, lots of room, huge comfy bed with Frette linens. The phone systems in the rooms are cool too because you can control the lighting, temperature and many other features Very nice not getting out of bed to turn off the lights. And every night they would do a turn down service where you would get a fancy chocolate and a note describing the weather for the next day. Molton Brown amenities were divine! Breakfast came with the room and we were able to choose any thing we wanted from the XO restaurant inside. Hands down, best coffee and croissants anywhere! This was also the first time that my husband and I stayed somewhere and chose to eat room service lunch two days in a row because it was THAT good. The hotel also has a great location. I was amazed that we were only a few blocks (I think 2) from the Notre Dame Cathedral. And so close to Old Montreal. It made it so easy to walk around and see the sights. The doormen were always so welcoming. And the concierge was extremely helpful. There was one in particular that not only helped us with suggestions for restaurants but then asked us the next day how that particular restaurant was. A really nice touch that shows they care about you having a good time in their city. Went to the spa on Saturday afternoon and we had a great experience. The spa is something to be seen as far as it's decor. We both had 60 minute hot stone massages which were the best I have ever had. As for facial treatments, the "mask" is literally just that and not a traditional facial like I am used to. Next time I will take the 90 minute massage instead and skip the face treatment. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone and we am already planning a visit back this Fall!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleo13
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews. this hotel was a true 5 star. The service was the best ever, from the concierge to the front desk. The rooms were great. The beds, pillows, sheets, huge towels, free shoeshines and really awesome shower just made it even better. Their breakfast which was included in our rate was called a continental breakfast but was a full breakfast with choice of eggs, bacon and the most delicious pastries and croissants. I have stayed in other 5 star hotels and this is up there with the best. The location in Old Montreal was also good, near lots of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Service Service Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a very discerning traveler with high expectations, Le St. James did not disappoint. Excelling in all areas, this hotel clearly raises the bar in hospitality excellence. From the moment my door was opened by their valet, to the time we exited their lobby, this hotel intuitively knew how to please us and went out of their way to accommodate our every need. Definitely a place to visit for those who expect the best!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: fixxed
Reviews.Content: I go to Montreal every month and this Hotel is the BEST in Montreal - and can complete with any hotel in the world. The service is European - they know what they are doing. Over the top? Perhaps, but isn't that what you want. Who complains when 2 staff come out with umbrellas when you drive up. Service in the restaurant and bar is quiet and professional - but friendly. This hotel is for those that want, and perhaps remember or pine for, the great servie from the great hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: nick98Chicago
Reviews.Content: We like to be pampered and we were pampered... Dinner at XO restaurant was great the first night despite the initial wait in the lounge. the morning complimentary coffee was a nice touch on the way out. My wife loved the flowers in the public areas (quite unusual and very impressive) I was able to have a smaller version of the arrangement delivered by the concierge and surprised my wife.The location in old Montreal allowed us to walk around and shop for the kids. This is a five star hotel and not the cheapest in Montreal but a great value if you look for service and romance.We usually pay more in the US for a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: newgotogirl
Reviews.Content: The property is absolutely elegant! My daughter and I went there for a "girls getaway." From the moment we arrived we were treated like queens. Our room was very well appointed with all the comforts of home and more. Le Spa was wonderfully private and relaxing. Next came a creative Tasting menu in XO, where we enjoyed Wine pairings with each course and every dish was tasty and unique! We ordered Room service for breakfast and it was delivered hot, on time and delicious! The location is one of the best parts for me, away from the crowds and traffic of downtown , a great walk around Old Montreal to shop and dine. Our stay went too quickly! We will definitely visit again, and next time we will plan to stay longer. We enjoyed every minute of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Try every other hotel first”
Reviews.Author: EricWB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the service pretentious and of poor quality. We had planned on spending almost all of our down time at the hotel, however, we realized we would be treated better dining elsewhere. When we voiced our concern, we were ignored. The management is preoccupied with showing and selling the glitz and not focused on the customers; we could not wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service BUT not good for young family”
Reviews.Author: Sealover2008
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, with great service and location. We stayed in a suite connected to a deluxe bedroom (for 5 of us) and felt it was claustrophobic. We are used to much more space than that, usually same configuration (2 bedroom suite) and these rooms were tiny (but elegant). We looked into other suites but nothing would work for a family with 3 young ones. Anyway, I would highly recommend this hotel for couples, but not at all for people with children coming along. There is basically no common areas, and the restaurant XO is very odd. Room service is out of control: no kids menu, and in the adults menu the selection is exotic. Couldn't get a mac-and-cheese, we got very close with a selection of pasta and white sauce that cost us $30 and the kids did not like it. Room service took about 1:30 hours to deliver - including our sandwich and a salad - no drinks, not even soda - the bill was $170. Even wine or champagne from the room service was a looong wait. Now, you may call my kids spoiled but they were sad that there were no little special gifts for them - you know how the Ritz offer those little lions, Four seasons leave a beautiful tray of cookies on arrival and other little gifts, le St James basically just absolutely ignored them, not even trying to know their names (and they are usually greeted by their names everywhere we travel). All in all, this hotel is at our level of luxury but it is not for us. We left one day earlier than planned.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Escape”
Reviews.Author: rome1
Reviews.Content: Le St. James is a beautiful, little jewel of a hotel, which sets the standard in Montreal. The owners have incorporated various elements that one would expect to see at the best hotels around the world. The hotel was filled with beautiful art and antiques.
